head.title: Fitting Right In at Lyford Cay

hedline.hl1: Fitting Right In at Lyford Cay

abstract.p: Tiina Tulikorpi letter comments on May 25 article on Lyford Cay

block.p: From your article ''Storming the Last Civilized Sandbox'' (May 25), it seems as if the residents of Lyford Cay are rejecting Peter Nygard. Quite the opposite, in fact, is true. Mr. Nygard has excellent neighborly relations with the majority of the Lyford Cay residents.

From your article ''Storming the Last Civilized Sandbox'' (May 25), it seems as if the residents of Lyford Cay are rejecting Peter Nygard. Quite the opposite, in fact, is true. Mr. Nygard has excellent neighborly relations with the majority of the Lyford Cay residents.

In reference to the work Mr. Nygard is doing to keep up and expand the beaches at Nygard Cay, it fully conforms to a long-established practice by a majority of the Lyford Cay Beach property owners to maintain and build their beaches. Such development has been studied and recommended by professional beach engineers and fully approved by the Lyford Cay Property Association and the government of the Bahamas; in fact, he is one of the last of the ocean-side residents to undertake such preservation and development of the beach.
TIINA TULIKORPI Marketing and promotions director, Nygard.com
